linalg_simple_test.cpp

Calculates the mean vector of array "x". Given a d -dimensional array x with size N1 x ... x Nd, this function calculates the mean vector given as:

Example:

Parameters:
x multidimensional array, from which the mean value will be calculated
Returns:
the mean vector of x
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates that x is only one-dimensional or has no dimensions
Please follow the link to view the source code of the example. The example can be executed in the example directory of package LinAlg.

Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1995
Changes
none
Status
stable

00061 // Will initialize a vector or 2-dimensional matrix
00062 // by random numbers:
00063 //
00064 void init_array( Array< double > &a )
00065 {
00066     Uniform  uni;           // Random number generator:
00067     unsigned no_dims( 0 ),  // No. of Array dimensions.
00068              no_rows( 0 ),  // No. of rows (matrix) or columns (vector).
00069              no_cols( 0 ),  // No. of columns (matrix).
00070              curr_row,      // Current row (matrix) or column (vector).
00071              curr_col;      // Current column (matrix).
00072 
00073 
00074     // Determine no. of dimensions, rows and columns:
00075     no_dims = a.ndim( );
00076     if ( no_dims < 1 || no_dims > 2 ) 
00077     {
00078         cerr << "Can't initialize array - dimension error!" << endl;
00079         exit( 1 );
00080     }
00081     no_rows = a.dim( 0 );
00082     if ( no_dims > 1 ) no_cols = a.dim( 1 );
00083 
00084     // Initialize Array:
00085     for ( curr_row = 0; curr_row < no_rows; curr_row++ )
00086     {
00087         // Vector:
00088         if ( no_dims == 1 )
00089         {
00090             a( curr_row ) = uni( -9., 9. );
00091         } 
00092         else
00093         {
00094         // Matrix:
00095             for ( curr_col = 0; curr_col < no_cols; curr_col++ )
00096             {
00097               a( curr_row, curr_col ) = uni( -9., 9. );
00098             }
00099         }
00100     }
00101 
00102     return;
00103 }

00106 // Example for function "mean(...)":
00107 void test_mean( Array< double > &input )
00108 {
00109     Array< double > mean_vec; // Vector of mean values.
00110 
00111     // Clear result vector:
00112     mean_vec = 0.;
00113     // Calculate mean vector:
00114     mean_vec = mean( input );
00115     // Output of input matrix and mean values vector:
00116     cout << "input matrix:" << endl;
00117     writeArray( input, cout );
00118     cout << "vector of matrix mean values:" << endl;
00119     writeArray( mean_vec, cout );
00120     cout << endl << endl;
00121 
00122     return;
00123 }

00126 // Example for function "variance(...)":
00127 void test_variance( Array< double > &input )
00128 {
00129     Array< double > var_vec; // Vector of variance values.
00130 
00131     // Clear result vector:
00132     var_vec = 0.;
00133     // Calculate variance vector:
00134     var_vec = variance( input );
00135     // Output of input matrix and variance vector:
00136     cout << "input matrix:" << endl;
00137     writeArray( input, cout );
00138     cout << "vector of matrix variance values:" << endl;
00139     writeArray( var_vec, cout );
00140     cout << endl << endl;
00141 
00142     return;
00143 }

00145 // Example for function "angle(...)":
00146 void test_angle( Array< double > &copy_from_matrix )
00147 {
00148     Array< double > x( 4 ),     // Input vectors.
00149                     y( 4 );
00150     double          angl( 0. ); // Angle between vectors.
00151 
00152 
00153     // Initialize vectors by copying rows no. 1 and 2
00154     // of global input matrix:
00155     x = copy_from_matrix[ 0 ];
00156     y = copy_from_matrix[ 1 ];
00157 
00158     
00159     // Calculate angle between the input vectors:
00160     angl = angle( x, y );
00161     // Output of input vectors and angle value:
00162     cout << "input vector x:" << endl;
00163     writeArray( x, cout );
00164     cout << endl;
00165     cout << "input vector y:" << endl;
00166     writeArray( y, cout );
00167     cout << endl;
00168     cout << "angle = " << angl << endl;
00169     cout << endl << endl;
00170 
00171     return;
00172 }

00175 // Example for function "transpose(...)":
00176 void test_transpose( Array< double > &input )
00177 {
00178     Array< double > trans_matrix; // Transposed matrix.
00179 
00180     // Clear result matrix:
00181     trans_matrix = 0.;
00182     // Calculate transpose matrix:
00183     trans_matrix = transpose( input );
00184     // Output of input matrix and transposed matrix:
00185     cout << "input matrix:" << endl;
00186     writeArray( input, cout );
00187     cout << endl;
00188     cout << "transposed matrix:" << endl;
00189     writeArray( trans_matrix, cout );
00190     cout << endl << endl;
00191 
00192     return;
00193 }

00196 // Example for function "diagonal(...)":
00197 void test_diagonal( )
00198 {
00199     Array< double > input_vec( 4 ); // Input vector.
00200     Array< double > matrix;         // Diagonal matrix.
00201 
00202 
00203     init_array( input_vec );
00204     // Clear result matrix:
00205     matrix = 0.;
00206     // Create diagonal matrix:
00207     matrix = diagonal( input_vec );
00208     // Output of input vector and diagonal matrix:
00209     cout << "input vector:" << endl;
00210     writeArray( input_vec, cout );
00211     cout << endl;
00212     cout << "diagonal matrix:" << endl;
00213     writeArray( matrix, cout );
00214     cout << endl << endl;
00215 
00216     return;
00217 }

00220 // Example for function "trace(...)":
00221 void test_trace( Array< double > input )
00222 {
00223     double diag_sum( 0. ); // Sum of diagonal values.
00224 
00225     // Determine sum of diagonal values of input matrix:
00226     diag_sum = trace( input );
00227     // Output of input matrix and sum of diagonal values:
00228     cout << "input matrix:" << endl;
00229     writeArray( input, cout );
00230     cout << endl;
00231     cout << "sum of diagonal values of matrix = " << diag_sum << endl;
00232     cout << endl << endl;
00233 
00234     return;
00235 }

00237 // Example for function "meanvar(...)":
00238 void test_meanvar( Array< double > input )
00239 {
00240     Array< double > mean_vec, // Vector of mean values.
00241                     var_vec;  // Variances vector.
00242 
00243     // Clear result vectors:
00244     mean_vec = 0.;
00245     var_vec = 0.;
00246     // Calculate mean and variance values:
00247     meanvar( input, mean_vec, var_vec );
00248     // Output of input matrix and result vectors:
00249     cout << "input matrix:" << endl;
00250     writeArray( input, cout );
00251     cout << "\nvector of mean values:" << endl;
00252     writeArray( mean_vec, cout );
00253     cout << "\nvariances vector:" << endl;
00254     writeArray( var_vec, cout );
00255     cout << endl << endl;
00256 
00257     return;
00258 }

00264

00266     init_array( input_matrix );
00267

00271     cout << "Testing function \"variance\":" << endl;

00278     test_transpose( input_matrix );
00279     cout << "----------------------------------------" << endl;
00280     cout << "Testing function \"diagonal\":" << endl;
00281     test_diagonal( );

00283     cout << "Testing function \"trace\":" << endl;

00285     cout << "----------------------------------------" << endl;
